zodipy._component#

class zodipy._component.Band(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, delta_zeta, v, p, delta_r)[source]#

Dust Band component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (float) – Density at 3 AU.

  • delta_zeta (float) – Shape parameter [deg].

  • v (float) – Shape parameter.

  • p (float) – Shape parameter.

  • delta_r (float) – Inner radial cutoff.

compute_density(X_helio, **_)[source]#

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]

class zodipy._component.Cloud(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, alpha, beta, gamma, mu)[source]#

Diffuse Cloud component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (float) – Density at 1 AU.

  • alpha (float) – Radial power-law exponent.

  • beta (float) – Vertical shape parameter.

  • gamma (float) – Vertical power-law exponent.

  • mu (float) – Widening parameter for the modified fan.

compute_density(X_helio, **_)[source]#

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]

class zodipy._component.Component(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega)[source]#

Base class for a DIRBE Interplanetary Dust Component.

Any component that inherits from this class needs to implement the compute_density method which takes in the heliocentric ecliptic cartesian coordinates of the line of sight, and optionally Earth’s position.

Parameters

  • x_0 (float) – x-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates [AU].

  • y_0 (float) – y-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates [AU].

  • z_0 (float) – z-offset from the Sun in heliocentric ecliptic coordinates [AU].

  • i (float) – Inclination with respect to the ecliptic plane [deg].

  • Omega (float) – Ascending node [deg].

abstract compute_density(X_helio, *, X_earth=None)[source]#

Returns the dust density of a component at points in the Solar System given by ‘X_helio’.

Parameters

  • X_helio (NDArray[np.floating]) – Heliocentric ecliptic coordinates (x, y, z) of points in the Solar System [AU].

  • X_earth (NDArray[np.floating] | None) – Heliocentric ecliptic coordinates of the Earth. Required for the Earth-trailing Feature [AU].

Return type

Density of the component at the points given by ‘X_helio’ [1/AU].

class zodipy._component.Feature(x_0, y_0, z_0, i, Omega, n_0, R, sigma_r, sigma_z, theta, sigma_theta)[source]#

Earth-trailing Feature component.

Parameters

  • n_0 (float) – Density at 1 AU.

  • R (float) – Radius of the peak density.

  • sigma_r (float) – Radial dispersion.

  • sigma_z (float) – Vertical dispersion.

  • theta (float) – Longitude with respect to Earth [deg].

  • sigma_theta (float) – Longitude dispersion [deg].

compute_density(X_helio, X_earth, **_)[source]#

See base class for documentation.

Return type

ndarray[Any, dtype[floating]]
